heading: Create Ticket
text:
POST /api/v2/tickets
Creates a new support ticket.
Required fields: subject, description, email OR requester_id, priority, status.
Optional fields: cc_emails, due_by, tags.
Example cURL:
curl -v -u user@example.com:API_KEY -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"subject":"Laptop issue","description":"Screen is flickering","email":"john@example.com","priority":1,"status":2}' https://yourdomain.freshservice.com/api/v2/tickets

heading: List Tickets
text:
GET /api/v2/tickets
Retrieves all tickets in the helpdesk. Supports filtering with query parameters like 'email', 'requester_id', 'updated_since'.
Example:
curl -v -u user@example.com:API_KEY -X GET https://yourdomain.freshservice.com/api/v2/tickets?updated_since=2023-01-01T00:00:00Z

heading: View Ticket
text:
GET /api/v2/tickets/{id}
View details of a specific ticket by ID.
Example:
curl -v -u user@example.com:API_KEY -X GET https://yourdomain.freshservice.com/api/v2/tickets/123

heading: Update Ticket
text:
PUT /api/v2/tickets/{id}
Updates fields of a specific ticket. Can modify subject, status, priority, due_by, etc.
Example:
curl -v -u user@example.com:API_KEY -X PUT -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"status":4}' https://yourdomain.freshservice.com/api/v2/tickets/123

heading: Delete Ticket
text:
DELETE /api/v2/tickets/{id}
Deletes a ticket permanently.
Example:
curl -v -u user@example.com:API_KEY -X DELETE https://yourdomain.freshservice.com/api/v2/tickets/123

heading: List Agents
text:
GET /api/v2/agents
Retrieves a list of all agents in your account.
Example:
curl -u user@example.com:API_KEY -X GET https://yourdomain.freshservice.com/api/v2/agents

heading: View Agent
text:
GET /api/v2/agents/{id}
View details of a specific agent.

heading: Create Agent
text:
POST /api/v2/agents
Creates a new agent. Required: email, first_name, last_name, role_id.
Example:
curl -u user@example.com:API_KEY -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"first_name":"Alice","last_name":"Smith","email":"alice@example.com","role_id":2}' https://yourdomain.freshservice.com/api/v2/agents

heading: List Requesters
text:
GET /api/v2/requesters
Retrieves all users (requesters) in your account.

heading: Create Requester
text:
POST /api/v2/requesters
Creates a new requester (end user).
Example:
curl -u user@example.com:API_KEY -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"first_name":"Bob","last_name":"Jones","email":"bob@example.com"}' https://yourdomain.freshservice.com/api/v2/requesters

heading: List Assets
text:
GET /api/v2/assets
Retrieve all assets in your inventory.

heading: View Asset
text:
GET /api/v2/assets/{id}
View details of a specific asset.

heading: Create Asset
text:
POST /api/v2/assets
Add a new asset to inventory.
Example:
curl -u user@example.com:API_KEY -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"name":"Dell Laptop","asset_type_id":5,"impact":2}' https://yourdomain.freshservice.com/api/v2/assets

heading: List SLAs
text:
GET /api/v2/slas
Retrieve SLA policies.

heading: Create SLA
text:
POST /api/v2/slas
Creates a new SLA policy with response and resolution times.

heading: List Problems
text:
GET /api/v2/problems
Retrieve all problem records.

heading: Create Problem
text:
POST /api/v2/problems
Creates a new problem record linked to incidents.

heading: List Changes
text:
GET /api/v2/changes
Retrieve all change requests.

heading: Create Change
text:
POST /api/v2/changes
Creates a new change request.

heading: List Releases
text:
GET /api/v2/releases
Retrieve all release records.

heading: Create Release
text:
POST /api/v2/releases
Creates a new release record.
